com.example.myurbanflix

Class MovieReviewAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<VH>
      • com.example.myurbanflix.FirestoreAdapter<com.example.myurbanflix.MovieReviewAdapter.ViewHolder>
        • com.example.myurbanflix.MovieReviewAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.firebase.firestore.EventListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot>

    public class MovieReviewAdapter
extends FirestoreAdapter<com.example.myurbanflix.MovieReviewAdapter.ViewHolder>
    This adapter is used for all recycler views in order to inflate movie_review_views and populate them with data from our firestore query. Additional functionality allows for recycler to enable/disable upvote downvote buttons for particular views, such as the ViewAccountActivity, which we do not want to be able to mutate reviews

      Constructor which initializes the moviereviewadapter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onBindViewHolder(com.example.myurbanflix.MovieReviewAdapter.ViewHolder holder, int position)
      when view holder is bound, gives holder document snapshot as well as a boolean value telling it whether it needs to enable the buttons on that view (usually based on user login status)
      com.example.myurbanflix.MovieReviewAdapter.ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGroup parent, int viewType)
      when a view holder is created, this takes its parent inflator and returns a new viewholder containing the information needed to inflate the view
